intro: Gnidiopsis microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed gnidiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by small, dry fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
